It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and is typically found growing on bare soil or rocky substrates. This moss thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in regions with low moisture availability. Didymoglossum bimarginatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other small organisms.
